Dummy Function with aruments that are used throughout the framework

Source: R/argument_conventions.R
argument_conventions.Rd

Dummy Function with aruments that are used throughout the framework

Arguments

lyt

layout object pre-data used for tabulation
var

string, variable name
vars

character vector. Multiple variable names.
lbl

string, label, often variable label
df

dataset
valuelblvar

string, name of variable containing split value display lables
varlbls

character vector. Labels for vars
splfmt

format spec. Format associated with this split.
newtoplev

boolean, Add this as a new top-level split (defining a new subtable directly under root). Defaults to FALSE
spl

A Split object defining a partitioning or analysis/tabulation of the data.
pos

numeric. Which top-level set of nested splits should the new layout feature be added to. Defaults to the current
fmt

format string for cells
cfun

function/NULL. tabulation function for creating content rows
cfmt

format spec. Format for content rows
splfun

function/NULL. custom splitting function
splname

string. Name associiated with this split (for pathing, etc)
splbl

string. Labe associated with this split
afun

function. Analysis function.
defrowlab

character vector. Default row labels for resulting analysis rows.
inclNAs

boolean. Should observations with NA in the var variable(s) be included when performing this analysis. Defaults to FALSE
valorder

character vector. Order that the split children should appear in resulting table.
baseline

character. Value of var to be taken as the baseline/control to be compared against.
compfun

function/string. The comparison function which accepts the analysis function outputs for two different partitions and returns a single value. Defaults to subraction. If a string, taken as the name of a function.
rowlblf

string. An sprintf style format string containing up to one "%s" which takes the current split value and generates the row label for the summary.
tt

TableTree. A TableTree object representing a populated table.
verbose

logical. Should additional information be displayed to the user. Defaults to FALSE.
colwidths

numeric vector. Column widths for use with vertical pagination. Currently ignored.

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Adrian Waddell, Gabriel Becker, Maximilian Mordig.
